dialogues.text: God, I wish I hated you as much as you hate yourself! Lynn throws the needle. Monix dodges it.

dialogues.speaker: LYNN
dialogues.text: I made sacrifices! How many years did I support you? And finally, after all of our blood and sweat and bullshit together, you got there, Monix! You made it, you won an NBA championship ring. It wasn't just about you, okay? And I'm sick of you acting like you're some kind of joke. You didn't blow it. You're not a fraud. You're not a fake champion. And all the time we spent together, fighting for you to get to that moment, was not a waste! You're a champion, you asshole! (BEAT)
But if you want to drink yourself to death, go ahead. Fuck you. With that, Lynn is gone. Monix stands alone in the bathro then checks his knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's practice. But this isn't basketball, it's DANCE PRACTICE. The entire team performs a complicated 'intro- dance.'

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: (CHOREOGRAPHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1 and 2 and 3 and 4 and turn like you mean it -- Bee Bee, Arch that back. Yes. Now, the waterfall... One by one, each dips down like a waterfall. And now a le kick.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Nice leg kick Kong. Those flexible hips are a coach's dream. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now big finish -- and freeze. And then we start the game after that.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Are we going to practice or what?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: This is practice, okay Clarence? We need to get two thousand people in here! Our intro dance has to blow people's minds. He begins pacing around, more passionate than ever...

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: From now on, I want our afros bigger... And shinier ... . I want our shorts shorter... And tighter... We're going to pull our tube socks up higher than we ever have before. The team seems to be looking off screen.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: What's wrong?
REVEAL: Monix has been watching this whole thing. With Mo on the court, everyone feels kind of stupid.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Hey, you're back! Listen, you should probably chalk your hands up for this number.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Jackie, I asked Monix to coach us.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Coach? Jackie is totally thrown by this. He looks around at the team. Clearly, a decision has been made.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: What do you mean, coach? (truly hurt) What is this? What's going on? (staring his team down) It's a Mutiny.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Jackie. Don't be like that.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Hold on a second. Last time I checked, we didn't live in Flint, Russia. We live in Flint, America. I'm coach until a new one is elected.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Don't make us elect Monix, man. (Jackie Moon holds firm) Alright, show of hands. Who wants Monix to step in as player-coach? Everyone feels bad, but they all raise their hands.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Please God No.

dialogues.speaker: TWIGGY MUNSON
dialogues.text: Sorry Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: (starting to cry) It's cool. I get it. I'm a big boy, I can handle it.
Jackie cries harder.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Don't take it so hard, Jackie. You're a great owner. We all know that.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Woah. Hold on. Did you just say 'great owner?'

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Everyone thinks so.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Now, when you said great owner, were you just saying that? Because it's not cool to mess with me about this.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: We mean it. For real. Monix is just more of an X's and O's kind of guy, that's all. Jackie is emotional. It's a bittersweet moment. He takes his whistle, then walks over and hands Monix his whistle.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: (re: The whistle) Here. You may need this. Now he pulls out a bunch of crazy notes on loose paper written in ball point pen. The pages look insane.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: (handing him papers) And here are some ideas for plays I've jotted down. Just thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Thanks Jackie. (to the team) The way I see it, any team in this league can put together a run. Most of our opponents are all flash. If we play unselfish, fundamental basketball, we can win games.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: I like it. Unselfish, guys.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Yes. Unselfish. Unselfish meaning tough team defense, full and half court traps, boxing your man out to help the team rebound. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unselfish means sprinting up the floor on every fast break NOT because you can get a DUNK -- and get your DICK SUCKED after the game -- but because if you sprint up the floor you might pull the defense out of position and free a teammate up for a high percentage shot.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Wait, so, what's going on with the blow jobs?

dialogues.speaker: BEE BEE ELLIS
dialogues.text: I vote we keep the blow jobs.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: (raising his hand) All in favor? Everyone raises their hands in favor of blow jobs.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Would everyone let the man talk please? Clarence is serious. This shuts everyone up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The starters have gotten into position, guarded by the sc team, in blue jerseys.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: The most important work we do on the court is away from the basketball. Monix FLIPS OPEN A SWITCH BLADE KNIFE AND STABS THE BALL, deflating it. This gets everyone's attention.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: (re: deflated ball) Until you start moving like a real team, you practice without a ball.
He flings the deflated ball into the bleachers and snaps knife closed.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Alright, Clarence, run the offense.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Set a pick for somebody. Clarence jogs over and stands next a scout team opponent.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Okay, that's kind of a pick, I guess. Try standing on the other side of Scootsie's man, so you free him up to cut into the lane. Monix corrects Clarence, moving his body the way he wants to stand.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Widen your stance. Plant your feet. Hands back. Like this. Now Scootsie GO. Set a pick for Jackie. Scootsie cuts across the lane. The team slowly gets i rotating faster.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Now Jackie pick Bee Bee's man, and rotate to the rim like this... Everyone move to the open space. And Clarence you swing back out up top. They've completed the play. Monix stands there, smiling. players look at each other, what's the big deal?

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: You know what that was?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: A flash to the high side post with an outside screen and a back door cut. Let's do it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ei 8.

dialogues.speaker: BEE BEE ELLIS
dialogues.text: Hey, how come you don't have to run with us? You're a player, just like the rest of us.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: I'm saving my knee for the games. Coach's decision. NOW RUN. Clarence sets a screen for Scootsie and they perform the basic rotation.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: (as they run) We're not just rotating, we're clearing out, making space. A pass and cut can change defensive match- ups. Creating seams can give us back door looks. Down screens can make a team vulnerable to penetration.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Hold on. I'm lost.

dialogues.speaker: BEE BEE ELLIS
dialogues.text: No shit. What's up with all of these fucked up words, man?

dialogues.speaker: TWIGGY MUNSON
dialogues.text: Yeah, what are we, building some kind of basketball space. ship?

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: You don't have to understand it yet. Just run it again. You heard me -- AGAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's many hours later...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team is still doing the exact same thing. Nothing in their moves have changed at all. They're exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: We've been running this play for a long time, man.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe we could try, like, play number two.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: No. We're running this play. We're running this play until we puke.

dialogues.speaker: BEE BEE ELLIS
dialogues.text: Basically, we have.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm pretty beat.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: 'Until we puke' is not a figure of speech. We are literally going to puke.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: What does he mean by 'literally?'

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: I think he's talking about vomit.

dialogues.speaker: BEE BEE ELLIS
dialogues.text: Not cool.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Monix, can I talk to you for .a second?

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: No. No talking.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Wait...

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Jackie hangs his head, but then accepts his fate. He runs

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: (as they run) We need to get in shape fellas. And we need to learn some fundamentals quick. -- AGAIN! They run it again, getting more and more winded.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: I want you to be brain dead. Because someday you're going to be too tired, or too nervous to think - - AGAIN! And when you are, this is the play I'm going to call. The play that your lungs and legs will have memorized. We will be able to run this in our sleep. Clarence tries to gag himself with his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: HEY! No sticking your fingers down your throat, Clarence, I saw that. You're going to puke. And it's going to be all natural -- AGAIN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan along a row of toilet stalls. Behind the doors, ea player is throwing up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACKIE IS THE LAST PLAYER LEFT. He crawls across the gym floor, dying. Monix screams down at his deflated body.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: You're fired!

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Get up and run. You're going to puke like everybody else.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Monix, I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: We'll. talk after you puke. GO!
Jackie can't get up, but he crawls, dying...

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: I can't puke Monix!

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Yes you can. Go. Jackie crawls harder along the hardwood.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Monix! You don't understand. I've never thrown up in my life.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: I've never puked. Ever.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: That makes no sense. Everyone has thrown up before.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: I haven't. I swear to God. I can eat anything. I can drink anything. I've been sick, but I've never puked. I swear to God.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: That's bullshit. Keep moving, you're going to puke.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: I don't puke. I can't do it! It's the truth! I swear on my Mother's grave. At this point, Monix can't help but be intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: What about when you were a baby? Babies throw up all the time.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: My Mom said I never did. I swear. She said I was fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: You can call my Dad! I've never puked. When Jackie looks up at Monix, it's clear he is not lying

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Isn't that kind of dangerous?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: What happens if you swallow poison?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: I don't know. I ate bad sausage before. But nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Stand up. Jackie manages to stand up.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Have you ever been punched in the Jejunum?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: I don't know. What's a Jejunum?

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: It's part of your small intestine.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: I don't know. I doubt-- BOOM. MONIX'S POWERFUL FIST LIFTS JACKIE'S TORSO IN THE AIR. ECU: Monix's knowing fist digs deep under Jackie's rib ca It's the hardest punch ever filmed. ON JACKIE'S REACTION: He stands, beyond pain, empty of an possible air. The blood leaves his face andhis eyesbecome confused, watering strangely. Part of Jackie's brain wants tospeak,buthe feelsunhuman-- his lips separate only slightly. He wanders out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: (to the sky) Mom?

dialogues.speaker: SHRUB. JACKIE WAILS IN DESPAIR.
dialogues.text: MONIX stands in the doorway, watching this.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: You okay? Jackie is about to speak, but then takes stock of his feelings. There is now an air of tranquility about him. Reborn. He's almost Euphoric...

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: I'm beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An intense game is underway. The Flint team works hard aw from the ball. As the Monix voice over continues, we watc the team move just like in practice. Monix is playing too Note: The team also looks 'hot.' Clarence plays with an e bigger afro. Jackie Moon sports a large perm, striped tub socks and the whitest thighs you've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .On offense, we share the ball. We look for the easy pass, not the spectacular pass... Jackie rolls off the pick and looks for it. For the first time in this sequence, we see the ball. Clarence has a cl passing lane -- He feeds Jackie for a lay up.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: . If a guy's more open than you are, he gets the ball... Instead of celebrating, Clarence hustles back on Defense. Tropics execute a half court trap. As we watch Monix play continue to the voice over from practice...

dialogues.speaker: MONIX, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: .On defense, we're going to learn to play together. We're going to use team traps to pressure people into turnovers. On the in bounds, Monix and Jackie Moon trap an opponent. Monix slaps the ball free. He flips to Clarence who fakes fast break dunk and dishes to Scootsie.

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Can you believe that? Jumping Johnny Johnson actually passed the ball.

dialogues.speaker: LOU REDWOOD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It was a great pass, too. The other team calls time out.

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And Jackie Moon has made several great defensive plays down the stretch. I tell you, Jackie's not afraid to knock people around in the lane. He's a monster.

dialogues.speaker: LOU REDWOOD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Like a retard in a China shop. A twenty-second time out on the floor, Monix huddles them

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: (huddling up) Listen up. I'll in-bound. Clarence, protect the ball and penetrate if you can. Kick it out to Scootsie or me and everyone crash the boards hard. Looking good, we're thirty seconds away from taking this one home. Let's bring it in.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: He's right guys. But remember, we want to win, but not by too much.

dialogues.speaker: TWIGGY MUNSON
dialogues.text: We don't want to win by too much?

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: What the Hell is he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: He's worried about the corn dogs.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: If we score a hundred points, everyone gets a free corn dog. There are signs everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Monix, but we don't even have corn dogs.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit. We're taking it to them.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: We're up by seven, Monix. Can't we just take it easy? We're talking about a lot of corn dogs here.

dialogues.speaker: BEE BEE ELLIS
dialogues.text: There could be a riot.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit about the corn dogs, okay? We play hard every second. We're running the offense. Everyone got that? Everyone nods. WHISTLE!

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The Tropics are just one bucket away from the magic number. Listen to this crowd. They know what's at stake: A free corn dog. Monix has the ball in his hands. He in bounds to Clarence Clarence penetrates and kicks it to Scootsie. Scootsie has an open look. He sizes up a jumper...

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Look at this, Jackie Moon has just blocked his own teammate's shot. I've never seen this before.

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Vakidis takes it up strong to the basket... BAM! JACKIE MOON TACKLES VAKIDIS INTO THE STANDS.

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Ooh. He gets taken out hard by the coach.

dialogues.speaker: LOU REDWOOD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Nice! The ball bounces into the air, rolls around the rim... An DROPS IN.

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And the basket is... GOOD! BUZZER! FINAL SCORE. TROPICS 100 PRO STARS 91.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

It was the first time in my life. And, well, it's made me feel... I guess you could say I've got a new clarity in life. (Everyone stares back) Since vomiting on Wednesday, I've been facing my demons. I'm not going to be an imposter any more. (BEAT)

dialogues.text: It's true. (turns away, dramatic) My Mom wrote it. Three weeks before she died. And I stole it. Even Monix is fascinated by this.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: No, she wrote it on a napkin. I duped the whole world. I'm nothing but a fraud. (BEAT)

dialogues.text: What does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: She married me because of my song, but I didn't write it. So sometimes I feel like it's not even me who's with her. (more emotional) Deep down, I feel like it's really my Mom who is making love to her. When I hold Lucy's supple breasts in my hands, they are my Mom's hands. When I eat a pair of edible panties off of her, they are my Mom's teeth.

dialogues.text: I'm living in a prison, Dukes.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Oh please! I could never write anything as brilliant as 'Love Me Sexy!' (standing tall) Listen to me, Tropics. Today is a new day. I didn't know you were in town this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON

dialogues.speaker: COMMISH

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWER

dialogues.speaker: INTERVIEWER
dialogues.text: Well, there you have it. Jackie Moon, thanks for stopping by. From channel 5, this is Mick Kenterman, signing off. Good night.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON

dialogues.text: Well, too bad, I'm SPUMONI-ING. PEOPLE START TO BOO. Jackie looks around at the angry cro

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: (tapping the bear) C'mon Dewie... (off screen) What's going on? Is he going to--

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE THE REF
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.text: Woah-ho. I've never seen that before.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: (to the handler)

dialogues.text: (to Clarence)

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: (screaming at the bear

dialogues.speaker: GELATO
dialogues.text: (in Italian) Asta zittu'sto parcnuso spumoni!

dialogues.text: (to Clarence)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tropics play awesome.

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And it's another sell-out crowd for the Flint Michigan Tropics. BUZZER! FINAL SCORE: TROPICS 111 COLONELS 98.

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Taking it strong to the rim is Coffee Black. Yes! This sold out crowd is going nuts. You've been a little quiet Lou, how are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: BUZZER
dialogues.text: The team celebrates the win.

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And, believe it or not, the Flint Tropics are in perfect position to qualify for the NBA merger. If they win their final game, they'll clinch fourth place. But nothing is ever easy against the first place San Antonio Spurs. As Jackie does a victory dance, the commissioner approach

dialogues.speaker: COMMISH
dialogues.text: Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Oh, hey Commish. Good game huh? And a packed house too.

dialogues.speaker: COMMISH
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you... And the rest of your team. Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole team stands solemnly.

dialogues.speaker: COMMISH
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but even if you beat the Spurs on Friday, we just can't have an NBA franchise in Flint.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: COMMISH
dialogues.text: It's just not good business. Flint isn't a big enough media market, okay? This stadium is small and, frankly, it needs to be torn down before someone gets hurt. I'm sorry but nobody ever thought you guys could ever get this far.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Well tough shit. This team did make it this far. Rules are rules.

dialogues.speaker: COMMISH
dialogues.text: Rules are rules... Until the expansion committee makes new rules. Then those rules are the rules. Everyone looks at each other. Jackie's brain has slipped a deep trance. He is no longer inside his body.

dialogues.speaker: COMMISH
dialogues.text: Don't take this personally, Jackie. These other teams have strong markets, new stadiums. It's just not going to happen for you Flint boys. I'm sorry. The devastation of what is happening is palpable. Nothing ever hurt this bad before.

dialogues.speaker: COMMISH
dialogues.text: I know you're going to punch me, Jackie. So let's just get it over with. The commissioner stands brave, eyes closed, chin out. Jackie is too confused and devastated to hit anything. He stumbles out of the room like a zombie. The team follows. The commissioner opens his eyes. A long silent beat...

dialogues.speaker: COMMISH
dialogues.text: (to himself) How did I get out of that one? Suddenly KONG darts in and squeezes the commissioner's ba with a kung fu grip.

dialogues.speaker: COMMISH
dialogues.text: Ah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team files out into the parking lot, totally devastat

dialogues.text: This can't be happening.

dialogues.speaker: BEE BEE ELLIS
dialogues.text: They can't just do this, can they?

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTSIE DOUBLE-DAY

dialogues.text: Petrelli with the rejection! It's out of bounds -- The Tropics keep the ball, with seven seconds on the clock. I'll tell you Lou, the Spurs were looking for that one. IN THE HUDDLE: Monix is yelling above the noise.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: (in the huddle) Okay, listen up: They've made adjustments out there. We can't just keep running the Alley Oop, okay? They're keying on Clarence. Everyone looks at each other, worried.

dialogues.speaker: SCOOTSIE DOUBLE-DAY
dialogues.text: We're not going to run the alley oop?

dialogues.speaker: BEE BEE ELLIS
dialogues.text: What are we going to run?

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: We're going to run The Puke.

dialogues.speaker: BEE BEE ELLIS
dialogues.text: The Puke?

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Don't tell me you've forgotten it. Everyone smiles at each other. They haven't.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: We're going to pick away from the ball. We're going to move to the open space. I won't in bound the ball until someone has a good look. (beat). The Puke.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Amen.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Bring it in! One two three--

dialogues.speaker: LET'S GET TROPICAL
dialogues.text: THE TROPICS RUN THE PUKE: A flash to the high side post w an outside screen and a back door cut.

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Monix, looking to inbound... SLO MO: Clarence sets a pick for Scootsie- Everyone rotat Jackie picks and rolls to the basket, open... Monix zips Jackie a no-look pass...

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Jackie goes up strong...

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: No Good! But Petrelli fouls him! JACKIE IS ABLE TO SHAKE OFF THE HEAD INJURY.

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Jackie Moon will shoot two free throws here, his team down by one, with two seconds on the clock. One will tie it. He needs both to win it. The ref hands Jackie the ball. The players take their pla along the lane. Jackie steps to the line. The whole arena on pins and needles.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: (to his team) Don't worry you guys, I got this... (to the ball girls) I am awesome at free throws.

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I'll tell you, I don't remember the last time I've ever seen Jackie attempt a free throw...

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: (Louder now, to the fans) IT'S OKAY EVERYBODY. SERIOUSLY.

dialogues.speaker: THING.
dialogues.text: Now Jackie sets up for the shot...

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: What the Hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: What, you've never seen me shoot free throws before?

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: He shoots them Granny style.

dialogues.speaker: BEE BEE ELLIS
dialogues.text: Always has.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: (to himself) Shit. Jackie's ritual is insane. He breathes, spins the ball, t around 360, deep knee bends, touches his left shoulder fo times, then SUDDENLY WINGS THE BALL HIGH IN THE AIR.

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The first attempt is... GOOD! IT SWISHES. THE CROWD GOES NUTS...

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The game is tied. One more and the Tropics win. Jackie does the same ritual. But this time a bead of swea rolls over his forehead. He is nervous. But he tosses anyway... SLO MO: The Ball floats toward the basket. Flash bulbs po SLO MO: The ball bounces off the rim, away from the baske SLO MO: Monix elbows his way into position for a rebound.

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ABA RADIO, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: No Good -- Monix with the put back! SLO MO: Monix catches the ball in the air and re-shoots a fade-away jumper. Swish! MUSIC CUE: 'HOME SWEET HOME' BY CAPTAIN FUNK.

dialogues.speaker: MEGA BOWL
dialogues.text: Victory. All the Tropics go crazy, screaming, they pile o top of each other at center court. The crowd is going nuts. Wheelchair Darren and Jody roll onto the court. Dukes jumps into the pile of players. Lyn has tears in her eyes. In the madness. LUCY MOON finds her husband, Jackie.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY MOON
dialogues.text: Jackie!

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Lucy?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY MOON
dialogues.text: Kiss me, you hero.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: My Mom says you're a bad lady. She says your vagina is for sad people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tropics fans pour out onto the streets from the sports ba and immediately start smashing shit. It's a total riot. A group of Flint COPS see the riot, then FLIP THEIR OWN C CAR OVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team is still celebrating, going crazy at center cour

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Wait, there really is a trophy?

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Hey, it's the Mega Bowl.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: We did it.

dialogues.speaker: BEGIN END CREDITS.
dialogues.text: As Credits roll, we hear a voice...

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: With their first pick in the 1977 NBA draft, the New Jersey Nets select...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NBA draft is crowded with businessmen and fans.

dialogues.speaker: DRAFT ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: .Shit, bitch, you be fine... Clarence stands up, happy, and walks on stage. He holds up a uniform with words: SHITBITCH U.B. PHYNE on REVEAL: In the crowd, Monix claps, cheering Clarence on.. is with wife, LYNN. But now Monix stands up and walks on stage too. He puts a YORK NETS hat on.

dialogues.speaker: DRAFT ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Here to welcome him is rookie Nets coach, Ed Monix. Monix and Clarence shake hands for the cameras.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Thanks for bringing me on board, coach.

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: All the good players were gone.

dialogues.speaker: CLARENCE
dialogues.text: Do we really have to live in New Jersey?

dialogues.speaker: MONIX
dialogues.text: Just smile for the cameras, Shitbitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jackie is in a recording studio, playing the synthesizer. plays some beats, then hits the keyboards.

dialogues.speaker: ORIGINAL SONG.
dialogues.text: We recognize Jackie's song as the most familiar song in t world. It's Gary Glitter's 'Rock N' Roll Part II' the mos famous sports-stadium standard in history.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: (singing Gary Glitter)
(waiting for the beats)

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: (waiting for the beats)

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: (singing Gary Glitter)

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: (waiting for the beats)

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: (waiting for the beats)

dialogues.speaker: HEY
dialogues.text: The song ends. The recording engineer pipes in.

dialogues.speaker: RECORDING ENGINEER
dialogues.text: Sounded pretty nice.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was a great take. Play that back for me, would you?

dialogues.speaker: RECORDING ENGINEER
dialogues.text: Listen, can you take that ring off for a little while? I'm getting some feedback from your microphone.

dialogues.speaker: PLACE DIAMOND RING.
dialogues.text: Jackie studies his ring with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: JACKIE MOON
dialogues.text: Sorry Robert, the ring stays on. MUSIC CUE: 'SHAKE YOUR GROOVE THING' BY PEACHES & HER END CREDITS CONTINUE.
